20.author: CardinalCoder64
20.body:
Thanks for this!

So before I applied for college, I was in a very prestigious school in the military, nuke school to be exact. They had us on some crazy hours, spending 14-16 hrs in the schoolhouse each day. The work they had us doing was also pretty intense. All exams were free response only and we had one nearly every week. It sucked.

But it was a huge learning experience for me. I know my limits now and how to study efficiently. I feel like college is gonna be a breeze bc of this, but there's still room for surprises I suppose. If college is anything like high school then I have confidence that I'll do fine.

Probably the biggest thing I have to get used to is how the whole process works, like how to register/drop classes, what books to get and how to get them, etc. I didn't have to worry about that in the military, I was just given everything all at once.

I'm currently doing full time taking 4 classes, and I'm getting all the classes I don't like over with first (so classes like english and speech). My schedule isn't so bad actually. I have 3 day weekends so I'll have plenty of time to relax. Mental health is a big priority for me but I think I'll be fine.

I'm looking forward to meeting new people and filling in my time with classes. It's gonna be a good year for me I'd say.

20.author: CardinalCoder64
20.body:
Thank you! I meant to respond to this earlier lol.

Yeah I think I'll be alright. As long as my mental health stays in shape then I should be fine. I'm not worried. Can't be any worse than what I had to put up with in the military lol.

I don't have any questions atm but if I do I'll let you know. :)

27.author: SuperSpeshBaby
27.body: I can give you the recipe if you want. It's not that hard to make. Maybe 20 minutes of active cooking time.

27.author: SuperSpeshBaby
27.body:
Ok, here you go:

Ingredients:

- 3 cups sugar 

- 3/4 cup butter

- 2/3 cup evaporated milk

- 1/2 tsp salt

- 12 oz white chocolate chips

- 7 oz jar marshmallow cream

- 1 tsp vanilla

- 1 cup crushed up oreo cookies

Directions:

Grease a 9x9 cake pan (I usually use the foil disposable ones that they sell in the grocery store). Add the sugar, butter, milk, and salt to a sauce pan and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once it reaches a full boil, let it boil for five minutes, still stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in the rest of the ingredients, starting with the marshmallow cream, and then pour into the prepared pan. Let cool for several hours or overnight, then cut up and enjoy!

28.author: mikebalsaricci
28.body: The problem with this question is it all really depends on the person and their situation things like age and what not. But it's more like, if you could only ever have one piece of candy in your whole life would you want a bland tasting everlasting gobstopper that never got smaller or the best tasting candy that would last like a couple seconds? I know it's not the same when you factor in everything that comes along with life, but that's sort of the question I was pondering.

28.author: Rachelcookie123
28.body: With the candy comparison, I feel like most people they want to try lots of different candies though. They want to try all the different flavours. So would they really be happy with just having one even if it’s apparently the best one? Even though there are so many different kinds they will never get to try?

28.author: mikebalsaricci
28.body: I suppose so, which is interesting to me. Because from a basic human level you don't need that much variety to survive or even to thrive in nature. That desire for variety is curious to me. You do need a balanced diet, but generally if you find a handful of good things that should be enough yet we do try to discover new things and countless new foods. It's strange to me, I don't know if that's just boredom or what, but the brain certainly rewards it.

35.author: brookeslegit2
35.body:
Haha steady on, I recommend either cardio or strength on a certain day, sometimes you can burn out combining the two (again experiment). 

TBH my biggest fear with IF was not being able to work out. for the first week I was a bit grouchy but now (for nearly a year now) its so second nature to not eat before 12 it has little impact except the odd stomach rumble. 

As I said with a lot of stuff there are split ideas on when to work out, I am definitely an evening person, think my body likes a bit of oil running before so, but I do shift work so generally end up alternating. regarding food, I just try not to eat within two hours of cardio or I get stitches, weights no problem if I'm running on empty or a full stomach 10 mins before. Play with it and see how you get on. 

Yeah regarding supplements its all up to you. I've tried a million and barely any have any noticable effects for me, I think its probably the same for 99% of them, but then again the placebo effect works and if it helps people feel better about themselves then why not?

Before your first workout I'd suggest either finding a beginners plan and researching the correct movements, or just writing out what you're looking to do, I used to turn up and wing it, then realised I was only working out arms and forgetting legs.

Typically I split my workouts into body parts that compliment each other (e.g. shoulders and chest are best buds for a lot of natural movements and tasks and you'll find your back and biceps despite being seperate also work together if you were to imagine lifting something heavy up) - you might want to google "push pull workout plans" as its a common way of doing it and provides an even structure across the week. 

"Push" - these are your chest presses, shoulder presses etc - I do two most important (dumbell chest press and flies) to start, then other "accessory" excercises after like cable flies. 

"Pull" - Pull downs, Bicep curls, Rows etc - again whatever is the most effort or "biggest" excercise, ill get the pulldowns and rows out the way and move on to others like the bicep curls. 

"Legs" - Squats, Leg press, leg raises, leg curls, lunges etc  - legs are the biggest muscle group in the body so get their own day.  

between days I'll do maybe 30 mins of running as a session. 

​

On a personal note about falling into it, you'll 'never be big enough' is a common phrase thrown about in the gym, and you'll always compare yourself to others there, but if you can just ignore that voice its all good. If I could show 14 year old obese me how I would turn out at 31 I'd be so happy. I'm not shredded but in decent working shape. 

I personally don't tend to weigh myself. You just know from your clothes and belt, if I could be bothered I'd probably do progress pics too, so yeah good idea!

​

Feel free to DM any time and I can't wait to hear how you get on.

35.author: brookeslegit2
35.body:
Yeah that’s it. Fitness is for life, I see it at the gym all the time, it’s just two weeks into Jan and already I come home from a silent evening at work because everyone’s given up already 😅 

Regarding muscle, tbh nobody knows, body builders actually tend to go for light weight with lots of reps and strength trainers lift heavy for low reps. The average folk among us will be fine with the standard 3 sets of 8-12 so I’d say just stick with that. Women will find it hard to get very muscly without serious supplementation (or steroids) because of the lower levels of testosterone, generally the girls at the gym who are strong as shit just look pretty well toned so I wouldn’t worry too much about that.

40.author: BotanicalUseOfZ
40.body:
He did very messed up stuff, but I think the whole thing in Untamed was that every person has a history, some of it nightmarish, and it shapes them and forces them into situations. XY had a past that didn't set hum up for anything but bad decisions and failure. It's there over and over, like the relationship between WWX and his bro was always hard because how JC's mom acted. Their sister was a bridge. I think that's why I liked it so much. They showed you the answer to why are they like this, and then built upon that as they grew up and changed, and learned from their regrets and their relationships, or fell deeper into that dark pit because they had no one.

Xue Yang though, maybe if he didn't keep laughing the same way Wei Wuxian did I might feel he's more evil than insane and broken. But he laughs the same as WWX does on the roof and it (to me) really conveys this feeling of being shattered. Like you can laugh or cry forever, and they both go to that I'm insane now laugh.

48.author: NovaAteBatman
48.body:
I was raised hearing "be kind to strangers" but almost never seeing it *actually* carried out. Well, it was carried out by my next door neighbors. But not in the household that was raising me.

> I know I’ve been through some hard times, and a random compliment from a stranger on something like my hair, or a small conversation about a band or pop culture shirt, has made my day. So I try to do the same for others.

This is such a huge thing to me. I don't understand how other people can't see how important it can be. I know I'll never get the random attention myself, but I can clearly see the need in others the same way I feel that need. So I try to give it to them, because people need kindness and attention.

48.author: NovaAteBatman
48.body: Please let me know when you need testers or it's ready! I'd love to see an app to help with this!

48.author: NovaAteBatman
48.body:
See, I'm caught somewhere between being afraid of other people, hating other people, and a little bit of wanting to make other people happy. (I wouldn't call myself a people pleaser.)

For the longest time I thought I was unexpected, but came to realize the truth later on. I was conceived to manipulate several people. There was a bonus of me having a heart defect that required major surgery. Unfortunately, I survived my surgery, causing many issues for the one that was looking for a convenient disposal method.

I'm an only child that still wasn't the favorite child.

I was very neglected growing up. I had to work hard for attention, too. Unless it was negative attention. That somehow found me really easily. (I'm not referring to acting out for attention.)

Not gonna lie, I do get something out of brightening someone else's day. I'll always just be that lonely kid that wishes someone would notice me enough to talk to me, even if just for a few minutes. That's dying inside for some kind words.

I think I hone in on that in other people, and I feel the need to fulfill that desperate need of theirs. Recognition from other people.

I don't think you're *not* kind at heart. You're meeting two needs, someone else's and your own.

I do hope you can overcome the people pleasing, because in my experience with a lot of people (both trying to please people when I was younger and watching others try to please people) is that it's hard to really find yourself as a person and hard to find fulfillment in life that isn't dependent on potentially awful people taking advantage of you. Also, other people don't tend to see the real you, just the one that pleases them.

If you'd like someone to talk to (no pleasing required), feel free to message me. 

I hope you have a great day. :)

48.author: NovaAteBatman
48.body:
My cup is pretty much always empty. I borrow the energy from future me to do it. It's not the healthiest, I know. 

I guess it helps that I've been almost exclusively locked up in my house since the plague started. But I did it quite a bit before that.

48.author: NovaAteBatman
48.body:
I'm one of those people that needs someone to talk to them but people never do.

> Those brief, pleasant exchanges can be like the beginning of the gradient of somebody's day

They really are. It's amazing to see how people just light up and when they walk off, it's almost like they're weightless compared to how they were feeling before you spoke to them.

Bboy dancing is break dancing. You know how people use to dance to American hip hop back in the 80's? They were known to do it on cardboard. I believe because it provided a smoothe surface for when they did spins on their hands, heads and backs.

My dad use to be in a dance crew. He's too old to move like he use to but he can still top rock and pop & lock some if the right song comes on.

49.author: zero_ph_uqs_given
49.body:
Break dancing! OK I gotcha. Nah I'm too uncoordinated for all that mess. It was cool shit to watch for sure though! Lol.

The box diving was fun indeed, but I'm still stacking pallets given I'm building everything I own from them! Lol. Had to have a place to store my belongings after going technically homeless. We're houseless but in the irs eyes, we homeless. Building a greenhouse out of pallets, a storage shed, and a gun range on the small piece of property we are buying and parked the camper. Just me, the wife, the dog, and forest. We have a sign up on the property "anyone found here at night, will not be found again". So far no visitors. 😁

49.author: zero_ph_uqs_given
49.body:
Thank you, home is where the heart is. As for building things I've always dabbled in structural engineering and physics but couldn't get through school. Being dyslexic, schizophrenic, and having a completely different learning style than the way they teach us kinda killed all professions for me. So I've grunt worked most of my life until now. No need for a daily job if I'm out of the machine (machine = working for someone else to make money, perpetuating the cycle of work sleep die) so my wife and I make do on photography. Not rich by any means making less than $20k a year. But it's enough to pay the mortgage for the land and keep food in my wife and dog's belly. I go without when I can to save a buck. I'll get there someday. Lol. ✌️💜🌮

Also, thank you. Seriously, the kindness you've shown shows you're a good human. Keep it up my friend. 🤘

50.author: Kayotime
50.body: I started dating a Gemini man 5 years ago. About 3 months ago that man came out to me as a woman. A month after that, I came out as her boyfriend instead of her girlfriend. Through it all, we've persevered. Now the two of us are helping each other feel our ways through our new, true identities and are coming up on our 6th anniversary in March. Gemini and Scorpio... not as bad a match as astrology would have you believe!

50.author: Kayotime
50.body: I never said I wholeheartedly believed this or abided by it religiously. I view it through a scholar's lense, purely for the purposes of learning about various different philosophies, cultures, etc. For example, I love learning about different religions. Do I believe in or follow any of those other religions? No. But it's always fascinating to hear about and see how other cultures live their lives in various different ways, and that includes learning their beliefs and folk lore. Just because I don't follow astrology as religiously as some other people, doesn't mean it isn't an interesting subject for study.

50.author: Kayotime
50.body: Exactly how I feel about my Arian Jupiter! I was like, wait hold up, that's so me! And have been trying to be a bit more responsible with my money since then. It's difficult, but one rule I always live by with astrology is: Don't use your sign as an excuse for your flaws, work on overcoming those flaws *despite* your sign. I've never been one to act moody and then say "Oh I'm a Scorpio, I can't help it." Instead I am aware that being a Scorpio makes me prone to mood swings, and I actively work to keep them under control, despite the challenge, always taking responsibility and never using my sign as an excuse to avoid blame or consequences, but acknowledging that it's a little more difficult for me and requires a bit more effort to control. I'm Sagittarius Rising, and I believe my Mars and Venus are in the exact opposite signs from the ones they naturally rule, so yeah, my chart is chock full of challenges, but the important thing is that I don't let those challenges define who I am or control my life. I am my own person, in charge of my own life. My zodiacs do not define me, they simply make certain aspects of life easier or more challenging depending on their position, requiring me to work harder in some areas while others come naturally to me. That's all.

64.author: NerdDwarf
64.body:
Children are a responsibility

Don't treat them like a gift to others. They're not

They are living breathing things that need to be cared for and looked after. 

They will be rambunctious. They will be loud. They will be annoying. They will cause sleep deprivation. They will make life difficult at every step. They will cost you lots of money. This is normal. This should be met with gentle, loving care.

Never blame them for being expensive. Never blame them for disturbing you.

You brought them into this world. They did not ask for this. They do not know how the world functions. Not just politics or interpersonal relationships. They won't know that cars move when they're not looking at them.

---The child of a "woman" who believed having children made her life better and then spent 19 years abusing them for not innately acting the way she had dreamed of, while simultaneously blaming them for every single mistake they ever made

70.author: yogurt_0000
70.body:
It's a complicated speech.   
I try to make it short and clear.   
  
Firstly It's necessary to make a premise: I do not have a sure and definite idea about AI but just a few questions and reflection on it.  
  
So the first thing to make clear is if AI is an instrument or something else.  
Is it an instrument like a brush for a painter, a camera for a photographer, photoshop for photo editor, etc., or something else?  
Especially in art, can the IA substitute the artist? Can AI really substitute the "thinker"?  
Or is the AI an instrument in the hands of the thinker?  
  
Secondly, in the next future may AI replace a lot of knowledge-based jobs? For example, AI can replace a doctor? I write down all my symptoms, all the data of blood exame, can the AI make the diagnosis?  
And if the answer is affirmative...How the world (especially the economic face) will be?

72.author: Powerful-Art-5156
72.body:
Unfortunately the climate (‘algorithm’) is constantly changing, so everyone’s success stories may not apply to you. What I can tell you is that Reels are some of the only content that is viewed on Meta platforms these days. High quality, engaging, passionate, and most importantly, useful content in the form of both Reels and engaging personally and sincerely with every account you possibly can. 

It’s exhausting and can be considered a full-time job itself, so don’t overwhelm yourself or judge your worth by your media presence. A lot of it boils down to being lucky enough to have your content shown to the small percentage of people who will potentially purchase from you. Wishing you luck, what is your business?

72.author: Powerful-Art-5156
72.body: It really is, especially without an editing background! Skilled carpenters definitely find respect and fame on Instagram, but always keep in mind the fact that luck plays the biggest role, right before commitment! People right now are looking for consistency- if something works for you once, do it again. And again. Fill your niche, without wearing yourself out creatively. It’s honestly very trying and not for everyone, but you’re starting out right and can do anything you want with enough passion and persistency!

Great questions, and thank you for your reply.

My absolute favorite is *The Picture of Dorian Gray* by Oscar Fingal O'Flahertie Wilde (Oscar Wilde).

Well, Darby is a dark brown/ light brown short hair cat. His fur on the sides of his face look like Fs. He’s bulky because he’s an inside/outside house cat. He is gentle and sweet, but he absolutely despises his outside brother, Eri. 

I’m not exactly sure how to link my cat’s picture. I can post it to my Reddit account… I think? It might take a minute. I do want to share a pic of his charming self, if you don’t mind, check it in a minute or two.

> I’m definitely a cat person, their quietness and self sufficient nature is great

106.author: TrazomGuyA
106.body:
I used to have a cat who would lick my face while I slept. He was actually the brother of Charlotte, his name was Lucky. They were both such sweet cats. I’ll always remember them.

I posted a few pics of my sweet boy Darby to my profile, you can check them if you want to! I’ll also get a pic of Eri and his flame tip ears!

111.author: Generous-Pirate
111.body: I got two pairs of cycling gloves (one fingerless and one for winter), two headbands and two cycling masks. Yes, I can ride this time of year - I'm in Croatia so the cold could definitely be worse, but I still have to put on many layers and a wind-proof jacket before even thinking of riding during the winter. I always try to ride everywhere every chance I get because I don't really like our public transport and I don't have/want a car yet, so the only days I don't are when it's snowing or raining.

111.author: Generous-Pirate
111.body: Oh and i forgot to add, if we're talking specifically MTB riding, that's a little more difficult to achieve during winter here because it can get quite muddy and slippery, but i still use every opportunity i can get

111.author: foilrider
111.body: Cool. I’ve just been riding indoors lately to keep in shape. There’s been snow on the ground and it’s too cold and slippery for me.

111.author: Generous-Pirate
111.body: Yeah i definitely get that, sometimes i have to mentally force myself to get on my bike when it gets really cold outside, so i too am waiting eagerly for warmer days 😅
